bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from B. E. Washburn to H. H. Howard, August 30, 1923 [Enclosed in C0302058]

div1.p: Washburn writes Howard that he is sending him a paper about yellow fever in Jamaica.

div1.head: Letter from B. E. Washburn to H. H. Howard, August 30, 1923 [Enclosed in C0302058]
div1.opener:
COPY
Old Harbour P.O. Jamaica, B.W.I.
August 30th, 1923.
Dr. H. H. Howard
International Health Board
61 Broadway
New York.
Dear Doctor Howard,
div1.p:
Replying to a letter received from you in June, I am
enclosing a paper entitled “Yellow Fever in Jamaica”. In all
the accounts of the disease in this Colony very little is men-
tioned in regard to its source. If I am able to find any further
facts I will send them to you.
